item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: A network scientist with a phd background on astroparticle and cosmological Physics, going to meet a leading expert on the evolution of cosmic structures and extragalactic magnetic fields.It's not the starting of a joke, but a real fact unfolding in real time. What can go wrong?@franco_vazza

item.title: JacksonBates
item.description: If you change the ?utm_source param of a social link to a swear word, will it show up in some marketing person's slide deck when they present their monthly update to their bosses?I don't know.But I might have a new hobby.

item.title: Mark Histed
item.description:
Sharing new preprint from our lab!
@biorxivpreprint

Led by Paul LaFosse, we show neurons in the awake üß†can filter out inputs: attenuation-by-suppression.Also: real neurons‚Äô activation function share features w/ #ai systems (eg ChatGPT).Comments welcome! Thread. #neuroscience #ai #NeuroAI #gpt #chatgpt 1/15
Preprint- https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.09.13.557650v1

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: @franco_vazza for the curious ones: we have identified a rather fundamental question to attack as physicists. The answer might be useful for a variety of Complex Systems embedded in space, but it's very hard to find.Challenge accepted.

item.title: Ned Yeung
item.description: Sad, but..."Heard of a cool tech-bro-weeding interview technique the other day. A male and female engineer conduct the interview session together. If, when the female engineer asks the candidate a question, he directs his answer to the male engineer, then he's out. They said it happens a lot"#Patriarchy #feminism

item.title: Sheril Kirshenbaum
item.description: Born in 1910, Dorothy Crowfoot Hodgkin perfected X-ray crystallography, a type of imaging using X-rays to determine a molecule‚Äôs three-dimensional structure.She determined the structures of insulin, penicillin & vitamin B12, leading to tremendous advances in medicine.Hodgkin was awarded a Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1964. She also advocated for world peace, campaigning against both the Vietnam War & nuclear weapons. https://www.nobelprize.org/womenwhochangedscience/stories/dorothy-hodgkin #HistoryRemix #science #history

item.title: Archaeo-Histories
item.description: Oldest Bronze Door (115 AD); still in use in Pantheon, Rome, Italy. This door cast in bronze for Emperor Hadrian (76-138 AD) rebuilding, dated about 115 AD.This large bronze doors to cella, measuring 4.45m wide by 7.53m high, yet so well balanced they can be pushed or pulled open easily by one person. Each half of double door weighs 8.5 tonnes, and rotates on pins set into floor and architrave above.#archaeohistories

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
Trying to wrap my head around it.I'm a brain researcher in a psychology department; arguably what they call a "cognitive neuroscientist with a computational bent." And I love me a good brain metaphor. But this (cognitive science) paragraph and I live on different planets, and I'm trying to wrap my head around why, exactly, that is. Curious to hear your thoughts.
In this kind of metaphorical thinking, psychic states (such as emotions) are local maxima in a multidimensional space, which is not constrained to inner-brain dimensions, but incorporates bodily and perceptual dimensions as well (see Barrett, Ochsner, & Gross, 2007). Local maxima are established through constraint satisfaction processes. That is, in any given situation, some dimensions are fixed at specific values, be they input-related dimensions (seeing a crocodile nearby) or the inner-psychic retrieval of specific thoughts (remembering a horrifying scene from a movie). The network system identifies the best com- promise solution given the constraints.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30654702/
I'm not here to belittle this in any way. But rather curious about all the embedded assumptions that go into my own way of thinking and how they compare with the ones that go into this paragraph. In that spirit, I want to firmly set aside the fact that the word "psychic" gives me chills and:*) I also like to think about dimensionality and how cognition is reflected in multi-D spaces (and I'm quite fluent in that).
*) I am curious about a few things. What is an "inner brain dimension?" Something about emotion/affect programs, I think. But it's not sensory input or body feedback. And so this paragraph is describing something like how perception, body feedback (interoception) and the other stuff that contributes (like memory and associations) combine to create our experience.
*) It focuses on the idea that our experience right now (a psychic state) is created by a "constraint satisfaction process" to maximize something. I can appreciate that once the question is posed in this metaphorical way, then one can inquire: how does that happen, exactly? But that's the big question of consciousness, I think?
*) I'm once again stuck by the jargon that separates us. Again, I'm quite adjacent to this world but not in it. Why aren't we better talking to one another? The 1st year undergrads I teach are really smart. Why aren't we all talking to them (to ensure we can talk to one another)?

item.title: Mike Tyka
item.description:
Awesome paper via @garymarcus :
LLMs can't do reverse inference:
For synthetic data (Mary is John's mother) the ability to reverse (John is thus Mary's son) was ~0% !
https://owainevans.github.io/reversal_curse.pdf
